results.title: An Approach for developing mathematical concepts
results.creator_credit: Dennis Claringbold and Melbourne College of Advanced Education. Media Production Centre
results.brief_description: Ross McKeown conducts a maths lesson for Year 2 students from Boronia Heights Primary School using the following steps. 1. Introduce concepts using concrete materials. 2. Games to reinforce concept. 3. Further practice and revision of concept. 4. Evaluation and recording of progress. Uses the concept of place value to demonstrate these techniques.

results.title: An Apple a day
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
Made before eating disorders were recognised as serious diseases, this documentary focuses on a hospital dietitian, a dentist and women in a dieting club as they discuss the evils of overeating. It also highlights the importance of good nutrition and regular exercise in maintaining a slender figure.

results.title: An Animated Atlas of the World (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Mike West
results.brief_description: Strongman, Atlas, is the humorous animated host of this tour around the globe. Sounding like the recent movie hero “Rocky”, Atlas provides accurate information on weather, wind, tides, storms and general geography for each country he visits. The film combines animation and some short live-action segments.

results.title: An American werewolf in London [DVD]
results.creator_credit: George Folsey Jr, Lycanthrope Films and John Landis
results.brief_description: David and Jack are two American backpackers off for a three-month trek of Europe. Whilst wandering the desolate English countryside they happen upon a quaint pub with a mysterious patron who warns them not to leave the road when walking after dark. Ignoring such advice (as characters in horror films always do), the two inevitably find themselves lost in the moors being circled by a strange beast who attacks and kills Jack. David wakes up in a London hospital with nasty scratch wounds to his cheek and shoulder, and Jack soon appears, freshly deceased and rapidly decomposing, to deliver the grim news that David will in fact turn into a werewolf the next full moon. David dismisses the encounter as a hallucination, but all indications point to lycanthrope. Cast includes: David Naughton, Jenny Agutter and Griffin Dunne.

results.title: An American time capsule
results.creator_credit: Charles Braverman, Braverman Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Condenses 200 years of American history into three volatile minutes. The film is a chronological capsule of 1,300 visuals (paintings, still photographs, newspaper headlines, early newsreels, posters and political cartoons). No commentary - music “Beat that drum” by Sandy Nelson.

results.title: An American tail: Fievel goes west
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Steven Spielberg, Robert Watts, Phil Nibbelink and Simon Wells
results.brief_description: Fievel, the brave young mouse from the much loved “An American tail” returns in this Wild West adventure. Life is hard for the Mousekewitz family who struggle to make ends meet and to keep their dreams alive. Tanya wants to become a singer and Fievel wants to be like his hero Wylie Burp. Lured out West by crafty Cat R. Waul, Fievel uncovers a dastardly plot to turn new settlers into mouse burgers. With the help of his cat friend Tiger and the feared Wylie Burp, Fievel saves the day. Features the voices of James Stewart, John Cleese, Dom DeLuise and Amy Irving with Linda Ronstadt singing the song “Dreams to Dream”.

results.title: An American tail
results.brief_description: An animated film about a family of mice who travel from Russia to America to escape their persecution by cats. During their journey, the boy mouse Fievel falls overboard in a wild storm. In his attempts to be reunited with his family, he encounters a range of interesting characters, adventures and close encounters in dangerous and lively New York. When finally it seems he has lost his family forever, it is a friendly cat that finally reunites them. Voices include Dom DeLuise, Madeline Kahn, Nehemiah Persoff and Christopher Plummer.

results.title: An American in Paris
results.creator_credit: Arthur Freed, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation and Vincente Minnelli
results.brief_description: An American in Paris tells the story of an ex-GI art student who has fallen in love with a young French girl and then sadly has been parted from her. At their separation he reflects on his feelings towards Paris - the frustration’s, joys and miseries that have been part of his life and his falling in love. Gene Kelly teams up with Leslie Caron in this spectacularly staged musical featuring songs by George and Ira Gershwin. Academy Award for Best Film 1951.

results.title: An Album of sunny memories: for Delcie
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Dale Williamson and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dale Williamson provides rich detail of the life of her mother Delcie. From Victory Girl in her beloved Cygnet in Tasmania to wife and mother of four children, Delcie has led a life of simple joys and familial love.
